concept.title: Processing specialized attributes
concept.shortdesc: There are two kinds of specialized attributes: those specialized from props for conditional processing, and those specialized from base for other purposes.

dd.p: By default, the conditional processing behavior for the props attribute is expected to work with attributes specialized from the props attribute. This means that values in a new attribute that has been specialized from props can be conditionally processed to filter or flag the element in exactly the same way as any other conditional processing attribute, such as platform or audience.
By default, attributes specialized from the base attribute are not processed; any processing provided should be enabled to work with their generalized form as well.

conbody.p: See for information on the syntax of generalized attributes.
